content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `find_mean`. It computes the weighted mean of array `A` with weight vector `w`. Provide an example

Sure! Here is an example of a function `find_mean` in Julia that computes the weighted mean of an array `A` with weight vector `w`:

```julia
function find_mean(A, w)
    sum_weighted_values = sum(A .* w)
    sum_weights = sum(w)
    return sum_weighted_values / sum_weights
end
```

Here is an example of how you can use this function with an array `A` and a weight vector `w`:

```julia
A = [1, 2, 3, 4]
w = [0.2, 0.3, 0.1, 0.4]

result = find_mean(A, w)
println(result)  # This will print the weighted mean of the array A
```

You can run this code in a Julia environment to see the output. Let me know if you need further assistance!
